# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = ""
    for word in split(text)
        if length(lines) + length(word) > text_width
            lines *= "\n" * word
        else
            lines *= word
        end
    end
    return lines
end

# Example usage:
text = "Hello there this is a very long string that will be wrapped into multiple lines."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, text_width = 15)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This function will output the following:

```
Hello there
this is a very
long string that
will be wrapped
into multiple
lines.
```
